page.title: 05RELIGION - CHURCH/CHAPEL
page.content:
There are two places of worship in Cubert. The{Parish Church}and the {Methodist Chapel}where services are held usually twice each Sunday. Attendances average between 25 and 5O but increase at Church festivals and Chapel anniversaries.
The present Methodist Chapel was built in l846, but 'The Lantern', now a restaurant and dated l765, was the first Methodist Chapel in the village. In l979 the 2OOth Anniversary of John Wesley's visits to Cornwall, and in particular the dozen visits he made to Cubert between l75O-l778, were celebrated in great style, with local dignatories dressed in period costume retracing Wesley's steps. He stayed at Carines which is a local farm.
